snippet.title: The Punctuation Guide
snippet.description: The web's most comprehensive guide to American punctuation.

snippet.title: GrammarBook.com - Grammar and Punctuation | The Blue Book of ...
snippet.description: The #1 Grammar and Punctuation Resources Website - English grammar rules, capitalization, punctuation, whom, whomever, whoever, writing numbers, apostrophe, and The Blue Book of Grammar.

snippet.title: Guide to Proper Punctuation \- Library Online
snippet.description: Punctuation is powerful; one punctuation mark can change the whole meaning of a sentence. Valuable tips on implementing the basic rules of punctuation in every day writing.

snippet.title: Practical Punctuation Guide, Self-help Handouts - Writing ...
snippet.description: Commas; Semicolons; Colons; Dashes; Parentheses and Brackets; Ellipsis Points; Quotation Marks; Apostrophes; INTRODUCTION. Practical Punctuation Guide evolved from two projects of the Writing Center at Tidewater Community College, Virginia Beach Campus.

snippet.title: Ted's Punctuation Guide \- TedMontgomery.com
snippet.description: This is a punctuation guide describing how to use the period, ellipsis, comma, semicolon, colon, question mark, exclamation mark, quotation marks, parentheses, apostrophe, hyphen, dash, and capitalization.

snippet.title: Punctuation Marks - CommNet
snippet.description: Punctuation Marks . Click on the mark (on the tree or in the chart) to jump to that section:.?!:;- ...

snippet.title: The Purdue OWL: Punctuation
snippet.description: These OWL resources will help you with punctuation, such as using commas, quotation marks, apostrophes, and hyphens.

snippet.title: English Grammar and Punctuation Guide | PaperStarter.com
snippet.description: When it comes to writing a paper, the greatest ideas can be trumped by poor grammar and punctuation. While you can use a spelling or grammar checker to correct most errors, even computer-based checkers make mistakes.

snippet.title: Punctuation Guide \- Graphic and Web Style Guide \- University ...
snippet.description: Punctuation Guide Apostrophes. Use with an "s" to make a singular proper name possessive; e.g., Debra's; To express the shortened form of years of college classes; e.g.:

snippet.title: Garbl's Online Grammar Guides\--Punctuation too
snippet.description: Garbl's Editorial Style Manual--This style guide can help answer your writing questions about abbreviations, capitalization, grammar, numbers, organization terminology, punctuation, spelling and word usage.
